data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3392970,"name":"Sam","username":"Paraduks","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/p/ea5d25/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-28T22:40:08.974Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHi,\u003cbr\u003e\nIn several past posts, I have discussed my project of creating a “virtual test board” that allows coders to simulate their code on actual emulated \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eFRC\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"FIRST Robotics Competition\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e hardware and debug before the robot is built.  I plan to make this using the WebSockets simulation API to intercept the HAL, and build the program in a tool such as Unity.  Ive talked to a lot of experienced people, and come to the conclusion that fully replicating complex hardware like the SparkMax is an overly difficult task, at least for now.  With that in mind, I want to make a tool that replicates just the basics, so you can see that the right motors are spinning and the right vendor api calls are being made.  With this new focus in mind—-have there been any previous attempts at doing this, and what are the most important characteristics to include in my model of each component?\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2024-05-28T22:40:08.974Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":43,"reads":304,"readers_count":303,"score":290.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":466980,"topic_slug":"frc-hardware-simulator-virtual-test-bed-idea-and-questions","display_username":"Sam","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/sparkmax-electronic-circuit-simulation/466720/21","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"SparkMax outlining your goals here is important.  Do you want to do full robot physics emulation?  Or just individual mechanisms in a drag-and-drop wiring up models sort of thing?  Unity feels like overkill unless you are indeed trying to do full physics emulation.  Note there is another existing project (currently in development) that is built on WeBots instead of Unity, so you may want to look at it to see if it is aligned to your goals: \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/DeepBlueRobotics/DeepBlueSim\" class=\"inline-onebox\"\u003eGitHub -
